pr_title: BREAKING: Valid languages for Translations are now customizable

timeline.message:
Makes valid languages customizable

Fixes: SIRI-240

Restricts translations to supported languages

Fixes: SIRI-243

Improves handling of invalid language codes

Fixes: SIRI-240

Typo in NLS key

Fixes: SIRI-240

timeline.bodyText:
Validity check for languages is already performed during the creation of a Translation entity.
Double-checking when getting texts with invalid (or differently spelled) language codes currently leads to exceptions making affected pages unusable. Removed the check, since returning an empty Optional is sufficient here and keeps pages functional.
timeline.author: cschierle

timeline.bodyText: Humm, JournalData is not really the place to log errors.
timeline.author: idlira

replies.bodyText: the isValidLanguage() check in findOrCreateTranslation already produces a Handled exception (and returns null) if the language is invalid. So yeah, maybe the journal entry isn't needed then?
replies.author: cschierle

timeline.bodyText:
this is very unexpected behavior - isXXX returning true/false should never throw instead of returning false.
Rename to "assert / ensureValidLanguage" and remove return type?
